subject: Philosophy
title: Schopenhauer Discovers the East
description: A 60-second lesson on Schopenhauer Discovers the East.

hook.text: Arthur Schopenhauer kept a Buddha statue on his desk. In 1818, that was radically unusual.

buildup.text: He was the first major Western philosopher to take Eastern thought seriously.

discovery.text: His idea that suffering comes from desire mirrors the Buddha's Second Noble Truth almost exactly.

twist.text: He claimed he arrived at these ideas independently. The Upanishads confirmed what he already suspected.

climax.text: Schopenhauer opened the door. After him, Western philosophy could never ignore the East again.

punchline.text: He looked East before it was fashionable.

quiz.question: How did Schopenhauer's philosophy connect to Eastern thought?
options: His views on suffering mirrored Buddhist teachings
He translated the Tao Te Ching
